rows.<DBAF43F0>:
I will return to Colony 4 and prepare
for the worst-case scenario.
I'll be praying for your good luck.
Yeah. You can count on us.
However... our opponent is the Castle.
If we get too close, there's a risk we'll be attacked.
How do we proceed?
If we're careful, I think we can manage.

Come to think of it, you used to go to the Castle
every year forSender training or whatever, right?
I see... The Black Fog...
And there's quite a lot of it.

Especially around this time of
year, it blankets the entire area.
They didn't find us in that cave in Nih'l Valley, did they?
So... we can manage?
Probably.

The thick fog is good news, but what about
the danger of an Annihilation Event?

I never really paid it any mind until Taion
told me about it the other day, but...
strangely enough, it has never once happened there.
For real?
I don't know why.

Behind the Castle, the area facing the
lake serves as an ether collection site.

The ether collected there is transported
into the Castle through a supply entrance.
So we sneak in from there?
The transport containers are unmanned.

If we can get to the containers without
being spotted by the guards...
we can get inside the Castle.

Assuming we can slip past the guards outside,
how do we get around once we're in?

Taion, back in the fog, what was the
search range of the Colony 4 soldiers?
My assessment was that it was roughly 15 metri.

Here... in the personnel standby block, there's a
maintenance hatch that leads to the Castle's outer shell.

If we go through there and move along the outer rim, we
should be able to reach the base of the Annihilator.

And if we're on the outside, the chances
of being spotted by guards go down, too.
It seems doable.
I have one concern.

The Castle is the Queen's seat of power.
What if we're found by a Consul?
In that case, we'll likely have no choice but to fight.
...Though, it's not as if we don't have an escape route.
This is it.
In Keves, after the Coming-of-Age Ceremony...

...there's something called the Flowing Water Ceremony, a ritual where the
belongings of those who were sent off are placed on the water and sent adrift.
This is the waterway they use for it.
It connects directly to the lake outside the Castle.
I see...

If we can open the hatch next to the Annihilator
and ride the waterway's current out to the lake...
Water again?

Don't we end up jumping into water every
single time we make a run for it?
I'd rather not get my wings wet...

What d'you mean "every time"? It
was just that one other time!

Well, it's always best not to fight. Let's
just pray we don't run into anyone.
Then it's decided.
Yep.
Let's check our equipment and food, then we'll head out.
